title: Broiled Tilapia With Garlic
summary: Broiled Tilapia With Garlic is a caveman, gluten free, dairy free, and primal main course. One portion of this dish contains around 36g of protein, 17g of fat, and a total of 326 calories. For $3.87 per serving, this recipe covers 23% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe serves 1. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 15 minutes. 130 people were impressed by this recipe. A mixture of extra virgin olive oil, tilapia fillets, parsley, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so tasty. To use up the extra virgin olive oil you could follow this main course with the Peach Crisp: Healthy Crisp for Breakfast as a dessert. With a spoonacular score of 99%, this dish is great. Similar recipes are Broiled Parmesan Tilapia, Broiled Tilapia Parmesan, and Broiled Tilapia Parmesan.

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir are great choices for Tilapia. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. One wine you could try is Alsace Willm Pinot Gris Reserve. It has 4.4 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 16 dollars.

productMatches.title: Alsace Willm Pinot Gris Reserve
productMatches.description: An intense golden color with hints of ocher, the wine has a nose of ripe fruit, quince. In the mouth the attack is both supple and full, with notes of honey and spices. The final perfectly balances sugar and acidity.Pair this wine alongside pan-fried foie gras, grilled or roasted white meats (pork, veal), rabbit, poultry in cream sauce, smoked fish, mushroom dishes such as risotto.

instructions: Wash fish and pat dry.  Line broiler pan with tin foil. Place fish on the tin foil and season with salt, pepper, oregano, and parsley. Drizzle with olive oil and top with crushed garlic.Set broiler to low and place fish about 8 inches from the flame. Cook until fish is cooked through, about 7 minutes (be careful not to burn garlic). Serve with freshly squeezed lemon juice.

steps.step: Wash fish and pat dry.  Line broiler pan with tin foil.
Place fish on the tin foil and season with salt, pepper, oregano, and parsley.
Drizzle with olive oil and top with crushed garlic.Set broiler to low and place fish about 8 inches from the flame. Cook until fish is cooked through, about 7 minutes (be careful not to burn garlic).
Serve with freshly squeezed lemon juice.
